title: Tawhid
summary: Tawhid (Arabic: توحيد‎, tawḥīd, meaning "unification or oneness of God as per Islam (Arabic: الله Allāh)"; also romanized as Tawheed, Tawhid. , Tauheed or Tevhid[2]) is the indivisible oneness concept of monotheism in Islam.[3] Tawhid is the religion's central and single most important concept, upon which a Muslim's entire religious adherence rests. It unequivocally holds that God as per Islam (Arabic: الله Allāh) is One (Al-ʾAḥad) and Single (Al-Wāḥid).[4][5]
